Package com.game.Characters

Class Hero

java.lang.Object
com.game.Utilities.Position
com.game.Characters.Character
com.game.Characters.Hero
All Implemented Interfaces:
Score
public class Hero extends Character implements Score
Represents the hero character controlled by the player in the game.

This class extends the Character class, adding functionality for player input handling, scoring, and unique interactions such as item pickups and enemy encounters. It manages the hero's movement, animation, collision detection, and game state interactions.

  • Constructor Details

    • Hero

      public Hero(int speed, KeyHandler keyHandler, MainGamePanel gamePanel)
      Initializes the hero character with specific speed, position, and input handling.

      Positions the hero at a predefined location in the game world and sets up key handling for player movement and actions. Loads the hero's image resources and initializes the hero's collision area.

      Parameters:
      speed - the movement speed of the hero
      keyHandler - the key handler for processing player input
      gamePanel - the game panel the hero belongs to

  • Method Details

    • setDefaultPosition

      protected void setDefaultPosition()
      Description copied from class: Character
      Sets the default position of the character within the game world. Must be implemented by subclasses to define initial character placement.
      Specified by:
      setDefaultPosition in class Character

    • getImage

      public void getImage()
      Loads the image resources specifically for the hero character.

      Overrides the getImage method in the superclass to load images representing the hero character's appearance.

      Specified by:
      getImage in class Character

    • checkTileCollisionAndMoveHero

      public void checkTileCollisionAndMoveHero()

    • checkEnemyCollision

      public void checkEnemyCollision()
      Checks for collision between the hero and any enemy characters. If a collision is detected, it triggers an interaction with the enemy, usually resulting in a game event like the hero losing health or being defeated.

    • checkItemCollision

      public void checkItemCollision()
      Checks for collision between the hero and game items. If a collision is detected, it triggers the item pickup logic, which can result in changes to the hero's score, inventory, or state.

    • handleMysteriousSmoke

      public void handleMysteriousSmoke()
      Handles the effect of mysterious smoke tiles on the hero when encountered. If the hero is on a tile with mysterious smoke, this method triggers the logic associated with the mysterious smoke, such as altering the hero's state or affecting the hero's health or abilities.

    • CollisionCheck

      public void CollisionCheck()

    • update

      public boolean update()
      Updates the hero's state based on player input and game environment interactions.

      Manages movement, collision detection, enemy interactions, and item pickups. Also handles game state transitions such as reaching the end of a level or encountering an enemy.

    • interactEnemy

      public void interactEnemy(int enemyIndex)
      Handles interaction with an enemy character.
      Parameters:
      enemyIndex - the index of the encountered enemy

    • pickUpItem

      public void pickUpItem(int itemIndex)
      Manages the action of picking up an item and its effects on the hero.
      Parameters:
      itemIndex - the index of the item to be picked up

    • checkScore

      public boolean checkScore()
      Checks if the current score is greater than zero.

      This method is used to determine if the hero has accumulated any score points. It can be used in game logic to trigger certain events or validate game state conditions.

      Specified by:
      checkScore in interface Score
      Returns:
      true if the current score is greater than 0, otherwise false.

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Retrieves the current score of the hero.

      This method provides access to the hero's current score, allowing other parts of the game to display or otherwise use the score value.

      Specified by:
      getScore in interface Score
      Returns:
      the current score of the hero.

    • setScore

      public void setScore(int score)
      Sets the hero's score to a specified value.

      Allows for the direct setting of the hero's score, unless the hero is in an invincible state. In an invincible state, the score cannot be directly modified to prevent unintended score reduction.

      Specified by:
      setScore in interface Score
      Parameters:
      score - the new score value to set for the hero.

    • addScore

      public void addScore(int score)
      Increments the hero's score by a specified amount.

      This method adds the specified amount to the current score, allowing for score increases resulting from game events such as collecting items or defeating enemies.

      Specified by:
      addScore in interface Score
      Parameters:
      score - the amount to add to the current score.
